file_content.text: Thanaton has challenged me to an ancient duel called the Kaggath on the surface of Corellia. I have accepted.
Tulak Hord fought a Kaggath against his rival for fifteen years. A feast of souls. I never lacked for Force.
When it was over, he commanded that his dead rival's name never be spoken again. Such is the disgrace of failure, the glory of victory.
Then I shall do my best to win.
Failure isn't an option.
But Corellia is a small staging ground. Thanaton is a foolish little Sith. You will crush him.
I need to know Thanaton's weaknesses, to twist them to my advantage.
I require a plan.
He has chosen a single planet for the Kaggath. That is his weakness. He is a foolish little Sith.
I'll be happy if it gets Thanaton off my back.
I can't wait to kill Thanaton.
Corellia's all-out war right now. Imperial-held, Republic-challenged and loads of resistance.
Sounds to me like Thanaton's trying to beat you and the Republic at the same time.
He's using the battle to enhance his prestige in the Kaggath.
He wants glory.
Makes sense. There a better way to win glory than in battle?
There will be chaos!
There's the Sith Lord I signed up with. Crazy as a monkey-lizard.
I must find a way to turn the tide of battle against Thanaton.
The war is my advantage.
Break him down. Steal his glory. And then devour him.
Moff Pyron said he'd be waiting surface-side. Not my favorite guy, but you need all the allies you can get.
